item.summary: Constructor call with @CompileStatic causes ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException during compilation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This might be already fixed as a side effect of GROOVY-6390. If it still fails against 2.1.9-SNAPSHOT, then this is a distinct bug.
The stack contains an evaluateEqual, so I think it is not fixed by GROOVY-6390

reduced example:

class A{}
class B {
    A a = new A()
    @groovy.transform.CompileStatic
    B(){}
}

moving the transform on the class level makes the error disappear
fixed... this will now produce a compile time error. The example tries to pull non static compiled into a part that is static compiled, which is not allowed, thus the compile time error
